hackathon-description-text: Equithon is a social innovation hackathon that provides the tools for hackers to create solutions to social equality issues. We strive to provide valuable experiences to hackers with a range of skills and backgrounds.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: CEO @ Holland Bloorview Kids Rehabilitation Hospital
Founder and Chief Toy Maker @ Fidget Toys

hackathon-eligibility:
All students of any gender, from any academic field, from any school can participate at Equithon.
To be eligible for Equithon 2018, students must apply and be accepted.
hackathon-requirements:
Teams may enter their submissions for only one category.
Submissions must address an equity issue in one of five Equithon 2018 categories:
hackathon-rules:
Hacking begins at 10pm on Friday, May 4, 2018, and concludes at 11am on Sunday, May 6, 2018.
Teams of up to four members must enter a submission by the due date to be eligible for prizes. In the sake of fairness, projects submitted for prizes must be started no earlier than 10pm on Friday, May 4, 2018. Teams may not steal another team's source code. Submissions in violation of these rules will be disqualified.
You must be present at Equithon 2018 to enter a submission.
All participants must abide by the Code of Conduct online and in person. Read it here:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: One team will be announced as the winner of the Access to Education category. Each member of the team will have a choice of prize: Google Home Mini or Fit Bit Flex 2.
One team will be announced as the winner of the LGBTQ+ Rights category. Each member of the team will have a choice of prize: Google Home Mini or Fit Bit Flex 2.
One team will be announced as the winner of the Mental Health category. Each member of the team will have a choice of prize: Google Home Mini or Fit Bit Flex 2.
One team will be announced as the winner of the Physical Disabilities category. Each member of the team will have a choice of prize: Google Home Mini or Fit Bit Flex 2.
One team will be announced as the winner of the Women Empowerment category. Each member of the team will have a choice of prize: Google Home Mini or Fit Bit Flex 2.
In addition to the category prize, one team will win the overall Equithon 2018 prize after pitching their hack at the Closing Ceremonies.

hackathon-description-header: Equithon is a hackathon for students to create technical projects that solve an equity issue or promote equity.
hackathon-location-description: University of Waterloo - Science Teaching Complex
